title: 0t3p0t
author: 0t3p0t
content: I got my first Bitcoin just by joining signature campaigns as one of the perks of being a member on this Bitcointalk forum founded by the legendary Satoshi Nakamoto. I also purchased small fractions and even tried mining but unfortunately did not work due to the increasing difficulty and lack of profit in mining. For me earning Bitcoin through signature campaigns was more convenient and simple. You just need to qualify to the campaign requirements and dedicate your time and effort creating constructive posts to get paid on a weekly basis.¬† For now, since I have not met the minimum required merits earned for the last 120 days, I am still able to earn through altcoin bounties. But as soon as I got that required merit I will surely apply to Bitcoin paying campaigns. I encountered and got fractions of Bitcoin before diving myself into Altcoins. This forum really helps me and my family a lot. I learn and earn at the same time which is a perfect combination for me. How about you guys, did you earn your first Bitcoin through services here on this forum? Are you mining or you bought it as well? Which crypto came to you first, is it Bitcoin or Altcoins? What are your Bitcoin source at the moment if you don't mind me asking?

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: I have not really enjoyed how it feels to earn from the signature campaign, but I believe in the next few days I will be able to experience that feeling based on wearing my first avatar since I rank up to a full member rank, which I just unlocked recently. I believe it's going to be a good feeling and will add more motivation to me to run more research and learn more from the forum.¬†I'm already a holder of bitcoin, as I have a few fractions of it in my wallet that I purchased, and some were converted from my earnings from a few tasks I run online. I get paid with stable coins, which if I don't want to spend them, I convert to BTC.¬†No matter how little one can purchase, I always see it as a very important thing to do. I mean, to have as little as possible saved somewhere in your wallet, provided that the purchase is going to be larger than the fee, one should take the bold step of buying and saving it for themselves, so that when something positive happens and the person's price goes up, they won't be left behind.
